snippet.textDisplay:
Problem is, people were moaning about referees and their deficiencies! Now VAR has been introduced there is still a problem. Reality is there will always be a problem because the game in certain aspects is subjective and emotions added just contributes to the moaning. VARcould be faster in the decision making process but I like it. Reduces the amount of wrong decisions because what people fail to realise is the decisions in that Liverpool vs Wolves game was correct within the laws of the game! It's all good moaning when a miniscule decision goes against you but when it's for, no one is going to say we scored but his foot was marginally off!

People have a lapsed memory because before VAR the referees were being crucified for offsides and challenges not being called RIGHT without outside intervention!
snippet.textOriginal:

People have a lapsed memory because before VAR the referees were being crucified for offsides and challenges not being called RIGHT without outside intervention!

snippet.textDisplay: I think they are taking the final decision away from the onfield referee to avoid confrontation with fans and the dugouts. Imagine Klopp getting stuck into ref whilst he is watching the telly lol.

snippet.textDisplay:
I have tried to think of more ways we can rule out goals and ruin still further what ( WAS ) our Beautiful Game so I am proposing a COMPULSORY 5 MINUTE DELAY after EVERY goal to take the action back to the previous 5 minutes just in case there was an incorrect throw/free kick/corner in fact , ANY decision.
THAT should FINALLY clinch it and drain the last vestiges of this wonderful game I first attended over 2,000 matches ago in 1962.
WHO IS WITH ME ? COME ON !
snippet.textOriginal:
I have tried to think of more ways we can rule out goals and ruin still further what ( WAS ) our Beautiful Game so I am proposing a COMPULSORY 5 MINUTE DELAY after EVERY goal to take the action back to the previous 5 minutes just in case there was an incorrect throw/free kick/corner in fact , ANY decision.
THAT should FINALLY clinch it and drain the last vestiges of this wonderful game I first attended over 2,000 matches ago in 1962.
WHO IS WITH ME ?  COME ON !

snippet.textDisplay:
This is VAR V1 remember, it will evolve over coming seasons. As others have said, all var does is present the evidence in more detail, its still up to the officials to interpret and make the decision. The onfield officials are currently scared of using the pitchside screen to make a decision, they refer everything to Stockley Park, to absolve themselves of all contention it seems; Stockley Park on the other hand, for all subjective decisions are frightened of overturning the ref.
Id love to know the accuracy of the line for the offsides, we never get to see the ball being passed in the same frame to see the precision of the timing which is critical, also do they judge when the passers foot first touches the ball or when the ball leaves contact with his foot when passing forward to the player adjudged to be offside? - the devil is in the detail
snippet.textOriginal:
This is VAR V1 remember, it will evolve over coming seasons. As others have said, all var does is present the evidence in more detail, its still up to the officials to interpret and make the decision. The onfield officials are currently scared of using the pitchside screen to make a decision, they refer everything to Stockley Park, to absolve themselves of all contention it seems; Stockley Park on the other hand, for all subjective decisions are frightened of overturning the ref.
Id love to know the accuracy of the line for the offsides, we never get to see the ball being passed in the same frame to see the precision of the timing which is critical, also do they judge when the passers foot first touches the ball or when the ball leaves contact with his foot when passing forward to the player adjudged to be offside? - the devil is in the detail

snippet.textDisplay: So I'm reading all these comments where there are Liverpool fans saying that var isn't against Liverpool because there are some decisions that went against them. But none of these actually mattered. Every match they won that was almost title deciding, var helped them. The obvious penalty to Raheem Sterling. The various handballs of Trent Alexander Arnold. The decisions clearly favour Liverpool when it really matters. When it is a question of winning or losing. Serge auriers hand hitting the ball by accident when he clearly kept it against his chest was a handball, but Van Dijks wasn't?? One or two meaningless decisions not going your way doesn't mean liVARpool is fake.
snippet.textOriginal: So I'm reading all these comments where there are Liverpool fans saying that var isn't against Liverpool because there are some decisions that went against them. But none of these actually mattered. Every match they won that was almost title deciding, var helped them. The obvious penalty to Raheem Sterling. The various handballs of Trent Alexander Arnold. The decisions clearly favour Liverpool when it really matters. When it is a question of winning or losing. Serge auriers hand hitting the ball by accident when he clearly kept it against his chest was a handball, but Van Dijks wasn't?? One or two meaningless decisions not going your way doesn't mean liVARpool is fake.

snippet.textDisplay: Enough of this talk about removing VAR it's clearly for the better that it stays. What we should focus on is implementing more angles and clear cut rules, from what I saw VAR nailed it today. The wolves player was clearly offside because his shoe (a part of the body he can play the ball) was ahead of the liverpool defenders body ( the farthest part which he can clear the ball) no lines vagueness, if its vague it's a no goal that's it.
snippet.textOriginal: Enough of this talk about removing VAR it's clearly for the better that it stays. What we should focus on is implementing more angles and clear cut rules, from what I saw VAR nailed it today. The wolves player was clearly offside because his shoe (a part of the body he can play the ball) was ahead of the liverpool defenders body ( the farthest part which he can clear the ball) no lines vagueness, if its vague it's a no goal that's it.

snippet.textDisplay:
Poor referee decisions have made the difference in TWO title deciders between Liverpool and City, both in City's favour.
VAR is finally getting it right and allowing Liverpool to probably win the title when terrible referee decisions have lost them titles.
Vincent Kompany should have been sent off at the Etihad for that tackle on Salah last season. City won the title due to that terrible ref decision. With City down to ten men, no way would they have won that game 2-1. City gained 3 points and Liverpool 0. It decided the title.
Liverpool also lost the title in 2014 when a perfectly good Liverpool goal was ruled out at the Etihad on Boxing Day 2013. Again, City gained 3 points there and Liverpool 0. Even a draw that day would have won Liverpool the title.
If VAR was around in 2014 and last season, Liverpool would have had 2 Prem titles already.
snippet.textOriginal:
Poor referee decisions have made the difference in TWO title deciders between Liverpool and City, both in City's favour.
VAR is finally getting it right and allowing Liverpool to probably win the title when terrible referee decisions have lost them titles.
Vincent Kompany should have been sent off at the Etihad for that tackle on Salah last season. City won the title due to that terrible ref decision. With City down to ten men, no way would they have won that game 2-1. City gained 3 points and Liverpool 0. It decided the title.
Liverpool also lost the title in 2014 when a perfectly good Liverpool goal was ruled out at the Etihad on Boxing Day 2013. Again, City gained 3 points there and Liverpool 0. Even a draw that day would have won Liverpool the title.
If VAR was around in 2014 and last season, Liverpool would have had 2 Prem titles already.

snippet.textDisplay: The NRL here in Australia has been using VAR for some time now. The fans and players have accepted VAR as part & parcel of the game. All the issues surrounding the use of VAR in-game have been sorted and is now working well. Those 50/50 decisions are now 90/10, so there is much improvement. You’re only against VAR when the decision goes against your team. Accept the decision ppl.
snippet.textOriginal: The NRL here in Australia has been using VAR for some time now. The fans and players have accepted VAR as part & parcel of the game. All the issues surrounding the use of VAR in-game have been sorted and is now working well. Those 50/50 decisions are now 90/10, so there is much improvement. You’re only against VAR when the decision goes against your team. Accept the decision ppl.

snippet.textDisplay: As a Liverpool fan and even though LFC has benefitted from VAR, I still feel that the way VAR is implemented is incorrect. As a football fan, you want the actions and reactions immediate so VAR should only appear when a formal challenge is raised by either coaches, with each coach having a limited number of challenges. Whether the referee makes the final decision upon a video review can be up to a referee's preference or discretion.
snippet.textOriginal: As a Liverpool fan and even though LFC has benefitted from VAR, I still feel that the way VAR is implemented is incorrect. As a football fan, you want the actions and reactions immediate so VAR should only appear when a formal challenge is raised by either coaches, with each coach having a limited number of challenges. Whether the referee makes the final decision upon a video review can be up to a referee's preference or discretion.

snippet.textDisplay: Glenn Hoddle had a good idea. The replay we see on tv only shows the receiver of a pass. We don’t get to see the exact instant that the ball leaves the passer’s foot.The replay should be both ends of the pass on a split screen. At the moment, I believe VAR works too well, unintentionally. Microscopic offsides are commonplace in the game now, certainly an unintended consequence. Hopefully VAR will evolve into something geared toward correcting injustices.
snippet.textOriginal: Glenn Hoddle had a good idea. The replay we see on tv only shows the receiver of a pass. We don’t get to see the exact instant that the ball leaves the passer’s foot.The replay should be both ends of the pass on a split screen. At the moment, I believe VAR works too well, unintentionally. Microscopic offsides are commonplace in the game now, certainly an unintended consequence. Hopefully VAR will evolve into something geared toward correcting injustices.

snippet.textDisplay:
Studio presenters trying to whip up a story where one doesn't exist.

The goal, the ref made a mistake, VAR spotted it, so the goal stands.
The Wolves player's foot (or part of it) was offside. You can't be a little bit offside, like trying to be a little bit pregnant. So the goal get's chalked off.
A short while ago Firmino's armpit was offside - live with it.
The idea that a human being can see when the ball is kicked and see along the line at the same time is a technical impossibility. The number of goals that used to be given when someone was off side or goals chalked off when they were onside was ridiculous

The technology needs to be improved, communication to the fans in the stadium needs to exist (that is the real ly stupid thing) and the ref on the pitch needs to go to monitor like the rest of Europe's top leagues.
Wolves are a great team, they deserved something out of tonight, sometimes you don't get what you deserve.
Lastly, lazy journos and tv presenters need to shut up and talk about the actual football. Sometimes I think we would be better off watching the game without the punditary or commentary.
snippet.textOriginal:
Studio presenters trying to whip up a story where one doesn't exist. 

The goal, the ref made a mistake, VAR spotted it, so the goal stands.
The Wolves player's foot (or part of it) was offside. You can't be a little bit offside, like trying to be a little bit pregnant. So the goal get's chalked off.
A short while ago Firmino's armpit was offside - live with it.
The idea that a human being can see when the ball is kicked and see along the line at the same time is a technical impossibility. The number of goals that used to be given when someone was off side or goals chalked off when they were onside was ridiculous

The technology needs to be improved, communication to the fans in the stadium needs to exist (that is the real ly stupid thing) and the ref on the pitch needs to go to monitor like the rest of Europe's top leagues. 
Wolves are a great team, they deserved something out of tonight, sometimes you don't get what you deserve.
Lastly, lazy journos and tv presenters need to shut up and talk about the actual football. Sometimes I think we would be better off watching the game without the punditary or commentary.

snippet.authorDisplayName: Henk Williem Adriannus van der Napier
snippet.textDisplay:
VAR talks. Liverpool goal was definitely valid. The ball touched Lallana’s shoulder, not his hand.

Not very sure about Wolves’ goal disqualification though. What standard do they use? His “foot” was offside but his “armpit” was onside. Firmino’s goal against AV was written off because his armpit was offside. If that standard is used, then Wolves’ goal was valid. So what is it? Foot or armpit?
snippet.textOriginal:
VAR talks. Liverpool goal was definitely valid. The ball touched Lallana’s shoulder, not his hand.

Not very sure about Wolves’ goal disqualification though. What standard do they use? His “foot” was offside but his “armpit” was onside. Firmino’s goal against AV was written off because his armpit was offside. If that standard is used, then Wolves’ goal was valid. So what is it? Foot or armpit?

snippet.textDisplay: The problem isn’t VAR. It’s the new laws that are put out for it to follow. Every team has suffered from the offside farce and today it was wolves and Sheffield United. These marginals are not clear and obvious and no players are shouting offside. It’s not clear and obvious. It’s just these rules are a joke. Liverpool and wolves played well today good game but that offside I can’t celebrate it is a joke this offside margin, next week who knows who gets effected. The unfortunate thing as much as I hate this offside rule according to the law it is the right decision but that law needs changing.

snippet.textDisplay:
I shouldn’t be the only one who started to watch other leagues because the stupid VAR.
I used to be an Italian and Spanish soccer aficionado. A few years back. I had stopped following those two leagues, because of unfairness to small teams and favoritisms to bigger ones. Found the English league more decent and impeccable fairness. There were no exceptions.
Until now, where VAR, instead of helping to improve fairness and equilibrium. It has caused a great controversy and made the English league look dishonest. Wolves really deserved that goal!

snippet.textDisplay: Oh stop your whining all you salty Wolves fans. Just because you don't have the quality, determination or consistency of Liverpool you start crying and yelling Conspiracy!! Had the situation been reversed and Wolves got the benefit of the doubt, they would've been like, "oh the refs made great decisions today." The fact of the matter is that this is football. There will be controversial calls, some might go your way, some might not. What makes a team truly great is their ability to not let those decisions hinder them and keep working for the win. that's what liverpool did against Watford with the Mane situation, that's what we did again today. If Wolves actually took their chances and were more clinical, they might have won. But because they didn't, they allowed a controversial call to determine their game. We were the better team and that is that. Accept it or don't, Liverpool will remain strong and remain at the top of the league. Y'all can cry all you want 😂😂

snippet.textDisplay:
Love the African Experts and the Scousers saying "rules are rules" okay. I can accept that. I did when Raul's goal was disallowed earlier this season. So when I saw the SAME GOAL being scored tonight and being given I am left a lil pissed. Even more pissed that the fucktarded bin-dipping layabout council estate scum and their newfound African Scousers, still trying to get their City top off to put on a shitty red one, are belligerently ignoring that.

It is about time that the 19 teams have talk about what is going on. LFC get matches moved, VAR never costs them points and they get away with murder (LITERALLY IN THE CASE OF HILLSBORO!). I think it is time someone asks some big questions as this is all starting to smell fishy.

The worst part is that our fans have a horrible element. The firm. To get to the Mol means going through the subway... I am not gonna lie: I advise all scousers to avoid it when you come to us. Ive seen bad stuff before and I am not proud of any fan that is involved in hooliganism. No excuse for it but there is also no excuse for pretending like it isn't a thing. It is. So to the LFC fans, please be safe when in Wolvo. We don't want any bad press or any violence.
